question.title: How to create a optimal join with proper cascade between two entities in springboot for a movie db
question.body:
Hi i am making a content management system for an awards night company.

My current entity relation design

I have these base entities Content, Crew, Country, Genre, Language and then the joins of these like ContentCountry, ContentGenre etc. I want to make a service and controller to add new content and also edit it. The problem occurs when i want to add ContentCrew as in this i have an extra column by Enum.

ContentCrew Entity

@Entity
@Data
public class ContentCrew {
    @Id
    @GeneratedValue
    private Long contentCrewId;
    @ManyToOne
    @JoinColumn
    private Content content;
    @ManyToOne
    @JoinColumn
    private Crew crew;
    @Enumerated
    private CrewRole role;
}

Controller for this

@GetMapping({"/admin/content/add", "/admin/content/add/"})
    public String getContentAdd(Model model){
        model.addAttribute("contentForm", new NewContentForm());
        model.addAttribute("contentTypes", contentTypeService.getAllContentTypes());
        model.addAttribute("countries", countryService.getAllCountries());
        model.addAttribute("genres", genreService.getAllGenres());
        model.addAttribute("languages", languageService.getAllLanguages());
        model.addAttribute("crewList", crewService.getAllCrew());
        model.addAttribute("crewRoles", CrewRole.values());
        return "/admin/content/add";
    }

NewContentForm DTO:

@Data
public class NewContentForm {
    private Content content;
    private Long contentTypeId;
    private Set<String> countryCodes;
    private Set<Long> genreIds;
    private Set<String> languageCodes;
}

My thymeleaf form 

<body th:replace="fragments/layout :: body(~{::content})">
<div th:fragment="content">
    <div class="row justify-content-center">
        <div class="col-md-6">
            <h2 class="mb-4">Add New Content</h2>
            <form th:action="@{/admin/content/add}" th:object="${contentForm}" method="post">
                <div class="">
                    <h4>Add Content Details</h4>
                    <div class="form-group">
                        <div class="mb-3">
                            <label for="title" class="form-label">Title</label>
                            <input type="text" class="form-control" id="title" name="title"
                                   th:field="*{content.contentName}"
                                   placeholder="Enter title" required>
                        </div>
                        <div class="mb-3">
                            <label for="synopsis" class="form-label">Synopsis</label>
                            <textarea th:field="*{content.synopsis}" id="synopsis" class="form-control" rows="4" placeholder="Enter bio"></textarea>
                        </div>
                        <div class="mb-3">
                            <div class="row">
                                <div class="col">
                                    <label for="portraitUrl" class="form-label">Portrait Url</label>
                                    <input type="text" class="form-control" id="portraitUrl"
                                           th:field="*{content.portraitUrl}"
                                           placeholder="Enter portrait image url"/>
                                </div>
                                <div class="col">
                                    <label for="landscapeUrl" class="form-label">Landscape Url</label>
                                    <input type="text" class="form-control" id="landscapeUrl"
                                           th:field="*{content.landscapeUrl}"
                                           placeholder="Enter landscape image url"/>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="mb-3">
                            <label for="contentType" class="form-label">Select Content Type</label>
                            <select class="form-select" id="contentType" name="contentType"
                                    th:field="*{contentTypeId}">
                                <option th:each="contenttype : ${contentTypes}"
                                        th:value="${contenttype.contentTypeId}"
                                        th:text="${contenttype.contentTypeName}">
                                </option>
                            </select>
                        </div>
                        <div class="mb-3">
                            <div class="row">
                                <div class="col">
                                    <label for="countries" class="form-label">Countries</label>
                                    <select class="form-select choices-multi" id="countries" name="countryCodes" th:field="*{countryCodes}" multiple>
                                        <option th:each="country : ${countries}"
                                                th:value="${country.countryCode}"
                                                th:text="${country.countryName}">
                                        </option>
                                    </select>
                                    <small class="form-text text-light">Hold Ctrl (Windows) or Cmd (Mac) to select multiple.</small>
                                </div>
                                <div class="col">
                                    <label for="genres" class="form-label">Genres</label>
                                    <select class="form-select choices-multi" id="genres" name="genres" th:field="*{genreIds}" multiple>
                                        <option th:each="genre : ${genres}"
                                                th:value="${genre.genreId}"
                                                th:text="${genre.genreName}">
                                        </option>
                                    </select>
                                    <small class="form-text text-light">Hold Ctrl (Windows) or Cmd (Mac) to select multiple.</small>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                            <div class="row">
                                <div class="col">
                                    <label for="languages" class="form-label">Languages</label>
                                    <select class="form-select text-dark choices-multi" id="languages" name="languages" th:field="*{languageCodes}" multiple>
                                        <option th:each="language : ${languages}"
                                                th:value="${language.languageCode}"
                                                th:text="${language.languageName}">
                                        </option>
                                    </select>
                                    <small class="form-text text-light">Hold Ctrl (Windows) or Cmd (Mac) to select multiple.</small>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    

                </div>
                <div class="d-flex justify-content-between">
                    <a th:href="@{/admin/content}" class="btn btn-secondary">Back</a>
                    <button type="submit" class="btn btn-primary">Save</button>
                </div>
            </form>
        </div>
    </div>

</div>


</body>
</html>

How can I add new stuff into here also i dont have nay entity which holds all the fields like Content, all of its metadata. So I will have to use the join services to get all stuff by the content which might be inefficient. Any better way to do this?

answers.body:
In this scenario, we need to introduce a new table to maintain the many-to-many relationship between movies and cast members. A movie can have multiple people involved (such as actors, directors, writers), and a person can be involved in multiple movies in different roles. To model this relationship effectively, we can use a junction table that connects movies, persons, and roles.

cast table :

This table defines the different roles a person can have in a movie (e.g., Director, Actor, Writer).

id name
1 Director
2 Actor
3 Writer

person table :

This table stores the people involved in movies.

id name
1 Martin Scorsese
2 Christopher Nolan

movie table :

This table stores information about the movies.

id movie name
1 Inception
2 Interstellar

now the relationship table comes into the picture , that contains the relation ship between the movie , person and roles in a single view.

movie_cast_relationship_table :

This junction table defines the relationship between movies, persons, and their roles (cast).

id movie id person id cast id
1 1 2 1
2 2 2 1
... ... ... ...

This design provides a clear and normalized way to represent the many-to-many relationship between movies and people, with specific roles defined for each connection.

I prefer to use many-to-one to prevent recursive and relational fetching issue. You don't need to manage fetch type... It's less effort and less error... and less Frustate...

  • You need to fix your Content Entity, remove @OneToMany, @OneToOne, but let @ManyToMany without fetch type.
@Entity
@Data
public class Content {
    @Id
    @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)
    private Long contentId;
    private String contentName;
    @Column(columnDefinition = "TEXT")
    private String synopsis;
    @ManyToOne
    @JoinColumn(name = "content_type_id")
    private ContentType contentType;
    @ManyToOne
    @JoinColumn(name = "country_code")
    private Country countryCode;
    private String portraitUrl;
    private String landscapeUrl;
    private Boolean featured;
    @Enumerated(EnumType.STRING)
    private ContentApprovalStatus approvalStatus;
    @CreationTimestamp
    private LocalDateTime createTime;
    @UpdateTimestamp
    private LocalDateTime updateTime;
  • then create new Entity : ContentGenre and ContentLanguage
@Entity
@Data
public class ContentGenre {
    @Id
    @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)
    private Long contentId;
    @ManyToOne
    @JoinColumn(name = "content_id")
    private Content content;
    @ManyToOne
    @JoinColumn(name = "genre_id")
    private Genre genre;

}

@Entity
@Data
public class ContentLanguage {
    @Id
    @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)
    private Long contentId;
    @ManyToOne
    @JoinColumn(name = "content_id")
    private Content content;
    @ManyToOne
    @JoinColumn(name = "language_id")
    private Language language;

}

  • You don't need @OneToMany contentCrews inside Content Entity, you have Content and Crew on ContentCrew, so delete it

        @OneToMany(mappedBy = "content", cascade = CascadeType.ALL, orphanRemoval = true)
    private Set<ContentCrew> contentCrews;

  • You dont need @OneToMany contentCrew inside Crew Entity, you have ContentCrew table to handle it.

    @OneToMany(mappedBy = "crew", cascade = CascadeType.ALL, orphanRemoval = true)
    private Set<ContentCrew> contentCrews;

So, you just need ContentCrews to manage content and crews. If you want to get content by crew or get crew by content, jut use ContentCrew table and delete fetchType.LAZY.

public class ContentCrew {
    @Id
    @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)
    private Long id;
    @JoinColumn(name = "content_id")
    private Content content;
    @JoinColumn(name = "crew_id")
    private Crew crew;
    private String role;
}

This is the easiest manage entity for you...

Updated :

Tadi ask : In case i want to save a new content with the crew would i need to save the stuff in the contentcast repo like save content, save crew, new contentCast(content,cast,role) and save.

If You have single content and single crew.... do like this


Crew newCrew = new Crew("andi", "xxx","xxx",123331);

crewRepository.save(newCrew);

Content newContent = new Content("content A", "xxxx","xxxx",1231);
contentRepository.save(newContent);

ContentCrew contentCrew = new ContentCrew();
contentCrew.setContent(newContent);
contentCrew.setCrew(newCrew);
contentCrew.setRole("Heroine")

contentCrewRepository.save(contentCrew);

But if you have multiple crew on single content, then you need loop like this...

the json parameter, in example :

{
"contentName" :"content A";
"foo":"xxxxx";
"crewList": {
                "name": "Andi",
                "bar": "barr",
                "role": "Heroine"

            },
            {
                "name": "Jenny",
                "bar": "barrrr",
                "role": "Side Kick"
            }
}

Do this on your service

void save contentCrew(RequestDto dto){

    Content newContent = new Content();
    newContent.setContentName(dto.getContentName());
    newContent.setFoo(dto.getFoo());
    contentRepository.save(newContent);

    List<ContentCrew> contentCrewList = new ArrayList

    for(CrewDto crewDto: dto.getCrewList){

        Crew newCrew = new Crew();
        newCrew.setName(crewDto.getName());
        newCrew.setBar(crewDto.getBar()) 
        crewRepository.save(newCrew)
        
        ContentCrew contentCrew = new ContentCrew();
        contentCrew.setContent(newContent); //its from new content
        contentCrew.setCrew(newCrew); //its from new crew
        contentCrew.setRole(crewDto.getRole()); //this is the role

        contentCrewList.add(contentCrew); //add each 
    }

    contentCrewRepository.saveAll(contentCrewList); //save all content crew
}

question_comments.body: So sorry just give me some time and i will rephrase to ask a specific question

This question is not a good fit for SO. Please ask about specific problems for which we can help finding specific solutions. General "how to improve this code" without a clear problem statement or goal are out of scope.

79772404.body: @Tadi Also what about the submission entity, if i have contentCrew how will i take it in submission entity, will it be a set of contentCrew.
In case i want to save a new content with the crew would i need to save the stuff in the contentcast repo like save content, save crew, new contentCast(content,cast,role) and save.

79770750.body: I have added my current ER diagram can you view it once if it is possible for you. Thanks!
